awd_titl_txt: Early Fertility and Mortality Change in Europe
awd_abstract_narration: This project will complete analysis of one of the largest known                 family reconstitution data sets from Croatia, in historical                     Europe.  It will develop and test new statistical methods for                   dealing with incomplete data to improve the efficiency of data                  recovery.  It will confirm fertility control responses to                       fluctuating economic and political conditions and demonstrate                   early onset of fertility decline (CA. 1780) as a response to                    progressive inmiseration of the population.  It will show that                  demographic response is conditioned primarily by economic and                   social organizational factors rather than broad cultural factors.                                                                                               This research is important because it expands and improves the                  theory of the demographic transition from large to small                        families.  Understanding how this has happened in the past will                 help us design programs to impact family size in the future.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Social, Behavioral and Economic Sciences
org_div_long_name: Division of Behavioral and Cognitive Sciences
